title: Cosmos

awardEventDetails.title: 1981 Nominee Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.description: Adrian Malone (executive producer) - Geoffrey Haines-Stiles (senior producer) - David Kennard (senior producer) - Gregory Andorfer (producer)

awardEventDetails.title: 1981 Winner Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Individual Achievement - Creative Technical Crafts
awardEventDetails.description: John Allison (astronomical artist) - Adolf Schaller (astronomical artist) - Don Davis (astronomical artist) - Rick Sternbach (astronomical artist) - Jon Lomberg (astronomical artist) - Anne Norcia (astronomical artist) - Ernie Norcia (astronomical artist) (For premiere episode "The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean".)

awardEventDetails.title: 1981 Winner Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Individual Achievement - Creative Technical Crafts
awardEventDetails.description: Carey Melcher (technical designer) - Bob Buckner (magicam crew) - Stephen H. Burum (magicam crew) - Jim Dow (magicam crew) - John Gale (magicam crew) - Larry Heider (magicam crew) - Mike Johnson (magicam crew) - Robert C. King (magicam crew) - Cleve Landsberg (magicam crew) - Joe Matza (magicam crew) - George C. Reilly (magicam crew) - Joe Wolcott (magicam crew) (For premiere episode "The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean".)

awardEventDetails.title: 1981 Winner Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.description: Kent Gibson (tape sound mixer) - Gerald Zelinger (tape sound mixer) (For episode "Blues for a Red Planet".)

awardEventDetails.title: 1981 Nominee Primetime Emmy
awardEventDetails.description: Roy Stewart (video tape editor) (For premiere episode "The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean".)

awardEventDetails.title: 1981 Nominee Hugo
awardEventDetails.description: Carl Sagan (written by/director) - Ann Druyan (written by/director)

awardsHtml:
4 wins & 3 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

1981 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Informational Series
Adrian Malone (executive producer) - Geoffrey Haines-Stiles (senior producer) - David Kennard (senior producer) - Gregory Andorfer (producer)
1981 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement - Creative Technical Crafts
John Allison (astronomical artist) - Adolf Schaller (astronomical artist) - Don Davis (astronomical artist) - Rick Sternbach (astronomical artist) - Jon Lomberg (astronomical artist) - Anne Norcia (astronomical artist) - Ernie Norcia (astronomical artist) (For premiere episode "The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean".)
1981 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement - Creative Technical Crafts
Carey Melcher (technical designer) - Bob Buckner (magicam crew) - Stephen H. Burum (magicam crew) - Jim Dow (magicam crew) - John Gale (magicam crew) - Larry Heider (magicam crew) - Mike Johnson (magicam crew) - Robert C. King (magicam crew) - Cleve Landsberg (magicam crew) - Joe Matza (magicam crew) - George C. Reilly (magicam crew) - Joe Wolcott (magicam crew) (For premiere episode "The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean".)
1981 Winner Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement - Informational Programming
Kent Gibson (tape sound mixer) - Gerald Zelinger (tape sound mixer) (For episode "Blues for a Red Planet".)
1981 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Individual Achievement - Informational Programming
Roy Stewart (video tape editor) (For premiere episode "The Shores of the Cosmic Ocean".)

Peabody Awards

1981 Winner Peabody Award
Carl Sagan - Adrian Malone (executive producer)

Hugo Awards

1981 Nominee Hugo
Best Dramatic Presentation
Carl Sagan (written by/director) - Ann Druyan (written by/director)
